--creating external table in dediacted sql server pool

--step 1: create external datasource..

CREATE DATABASE SCOPED CREDENTIAL myCredential
WITH IDENTITY = 'Managed identity'
GO

--step 2: create external datasource
--if we want to cretae native external table then in the below script remove type..

CREATE EXTERNAL data source myDataSource WITH
(
    LOCATION = 'abfss://synapsecontainer@synapsestorage1505.dfs.core.windows.net',
    CREDENTIAL = myCredential,
    TYPE = HADOOP
)
GO


--stpe 3: create external file format..

CREATE EXTERNAL FILE FORMAT parquetFileFormat WITH(
    FORMAT_TYPE = PARQUET,
    DATA_COMPRESSION = 'org.apache.hadoop.io.compress.SnappyCodec'
)
GO

--step 5: create external tabl



CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE dbo.ext_table_hdp (
	[DateID] int,
	[MedallionID] int,
	[HackneyLicenseID] int,
	[PickupTimeID] int,
	[DropoffTimeID] int,
	[PickupGeographyID] int,
	[DropoffGeographyID] int,
	[PickupLatitude] float,
	[PickupLongitude] float,
	[PickupLatLong] nvarchar(4000),
	[DropoffLatitude] float,
	[DropoffLongitude] float,
	[DropoffLatLong] nvarchar(4000),
	[PassengerCount] int,
	[TripDurationSeconds] int,
	[TripDistanceMiles] float,
	[PaymentType] nvarchar(4000),
	[FareAmount] numeric(19,4),
	[SurchargeAmount] numeric(19,4),
	[TaxAmount] numeric(19,4),
	[TipAmount] numeric(19,4),
	[TollsAmount] numeric(19,4),
	[TotalAmount] numeric(19,4)
	)
	WITH (
	LOCATION = '/Data/NYCTripSmall.parquet',
	DATA_SOURCE = myDataSource,
	FILE_FORMAT = parquetFileFormat
	)
GO

SELECT * FROM dbo.ext_table_hdp



--stpes to create native external table..

CREATE DATABASE SCOPED CREDENTIAL myCredential1
WITH IDENTITY = 'Managed identity'
GO

--step 2: create external datasource
--(if we want to cretae native external table then in the below script remove type..)

CREATE EXTERNAL data source myDataSource1 WITH
(
    LOCATION = 'abfss://synapsecontainer@synapsestorage1505.dfs.core.windows.net',
    CREDENTIAL = myCredential1
   
)
GO


--stpe 3: create external file format..

CREATE EXTERNAL FILE FORMAT parquetFileFormat1 WITH(
    FORMAT_TYPE = PARQUET,
    DATA_COMPRESSION = 'org.apache.hadoop.io.compress.SnappyCodec'
)
GO

--step 5: create external tabl



CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE dbo.ext_table_native (
	[DateID] int,
	[MedallionID] int,
	[HackneyLicenseID] int,
	[PickupTimeID] int,
	[DropoffTimeID] int,
	[PickupGeographyID] int,
	[DropoffGeographyID] int,
	[PickupLatitude] float,
	[PickupLongitude] float,
	[PickupLatLong] nvarchar(4000),
	[DropoffLatitude] float,
	[DropoffLongitude] float,
	[DropoffLatLong] nvarchar(4000),
	[PassengerCount] int,
	[TripDurationSeconds] int,
	[TripDistanceMiles] float,
	[PaymentType] nvarchar(4000),
	[FareAmount] numeric(19,4),
	[SurchargeAmount] numeric(19,4),
	[TaxAmount] numeric(19,4),
	[TipAmount] numeric(19,4),
	[TollsAmount] numeric(19,4),
	[TotalAmount] numeric(19,4)
	)
	WITH (
	LOCATION = '/Data/NYCTripSmall.parquet',
	DATA_SOURCE = myDataSource1,
	FILE_FORMAT = parquetFileFormat1
	)
GO


--comparing performance of hadoop and native tables::

SELECT top 10* FROM dbo.ext_table_native

select top 10* from dbo.ext_table_hdp

--native is faster when compared to hadoop..time to execute is less in native..

--create table usning external tables through CTAS



create TABLE dbo.tb1
with
(

    distribution = hash(MedallionID),
    clustered columnstore index
)
as 
select * from dbo.ext_table_hdp
GO

select * from dbo.tb1
